DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sponsor-defined identifier which can be used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medical History Domain Medical History Sponsor Defined Identifier

ReferenceDocuments.name: What is the medical condition
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the medical condition or event identifier?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form
ReferenceDocuments.description: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

ReferenceDocuments.name: MHSPID
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile concomitant medications and/or procedure records with MH. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system. If CMMHNO or PRMHNO is used, this is the identifier to which CMMHNO or PRMHNO refers.
